contracts.title: Marsh Mill Dilapidation Repairs - Minor Works
contracts.description:
Marsh Mill is an 18th-century tower windmill in Thornton, Lancashire. It was built in 1794 and functioned as a corn mill until the 1920s and has been fully restored.

The mill requires internal and external decoration and some minor building works, and Wyre Council (the Council) are looking to appoint a suitably qualified contractor to undertake the works detailed in the attached specification document.

contracts.title: Thornton Little Theatre - Soft Market Test
contracts.description:
Wyre Council is launching a soft market test to explore options for the future operation of Thornton Little Theatre. Our aspiration is to collaborate with an organisation who can develop a commercial business plan to operate the facility, whilst also being able to offer access to the local cultural and community groups who currently use the facility. 

Interested parties are invited to request a meeting with council officers to learn more and arrange for a viewing of the facility before Monday

contracts.description:
Wyre Borough Council is looking for a main contractor to undertake the restoration of Mount Garden (Grade II Registered Park and Garden) and the Pavilion and Lodge buildings (Grade II Listed). The Mount is located in Fleetwood, Lancashire.

The contractor will be contracted to the Council.

contracts.title: The provision of services for stray dogs & kennelling service
contracts.description:
Under Section 149 of the Environmental Protection Act 1990, the local authority is responsible for discharging the functions for dealing with stray dogs (with the exception of dangerous dogs). 

 The Control of Dogs Order 1992 provides that dogs must wear a collar and tag giving the name and address of the owner when in a public place. In most cases, it is expected that this will enable the owner to be identified with relative ease. Failure to comply with this direction is an offence under Ani

contracts.title: The restoration of Mount Garden in Fleetwood
contracts.description:
Applications are invited from suitably experienced contractors (preferably in the public sector) with a proven track record in the restoration of parks and the construction of new features within them.

The restoration works include:
-       Regrading of site

-       Drainage

-       Relaying of existing terracotta edgings

-       Commission, supply and installation of terracotta edgings to match existing

-       Installation of street furniture

-       Grass seeding
